They have a great selection of breads and cheeses but where they stand out is their rotisserie meats. Chicken and turkey! You can't go wrong with one of those sandwiches. And while I don't enjnoy dolmas myself, my wife says they are delicious. 

Stop by here anytime you want a great sandwich but do be prepared to wait 10 minutes or so during the busy times.
author: Josh J.

description: My mom and I have know the owner and employees for a LONG time and frequented when I lived on the same block. It didn't have the best selection and was on the pricier side, but seeing once your food options close for the day or you need to run out cuz you forgot the milk, bread or just feel like a candy bar, it's always been a short walk away and open pretty late. I think now their always open till midnight though. The workers are usually always the same, and we're always managed to make good small talk when there about whatever came to mind. You could call it the grocery store of my teen/early adult hood.
author: Petra S.

description: I had the cranberry sauce added to the turkey sandwich today and WOW it adds 5 points to it. It adds a kick of sweetness which blended deliciously well with the ingredients. I'm in love...
author: Denise W.

description:
I remember this place before the renovation when it was a humble corner store. No more. It's bigger, has a great deli, and has definitely gone upscale with its food selection. On Thanksgiving weekend, that came in handy when I could get some Scharfenberger chocolate bars for my grandma here instead of venturing into Whole Foods or trying to cross town to shop at the Ferry Building.

I've also had a sandwich here, and they are large and high-quality. A great asset to the neighborhood.
author: Timothy O.

description: Some of the best deli sandwiches in town and their well-stocked shelves have saved many a dinner with items you won't find at your average corner store. Arguello Super is like a mini, locally owned Whole Foods!
author: Reed R.

description: The worst customer service ever and I'm talking about the cashier in his 40-50's. pointing his finger at me saying I cannot use my credit card if its under $5!
author: Mary L.

description:
Their Famous Turkey sandwich on Dutch Crunch is amazing.  I also get them to add cranberry sauce!!!  To die for.  Super fresh and healthy.  They take the fresh turkey out of the rotisserie and slice it right there.  
I give their sandwich a four star rating.  

The 3 star is for the dude at the register that was a total prick!  Yelled at me 3 times(and couldn't even speak English) that I was using an Amex card, stating over and over that they don't take Amex and that I was holding up his line.  I think I showed him my card 10 times, showing him that it was in fact a VISA!!!!  He didn't even apologize.  I think his name was Carlos.
author: Chase F.

description:
I'm giving this place 4 stars, but lets put a qualifier on this. 

The turkey sandwhich is the bomb, so as an eatery, the place earns its stars. Its a "damn this is good" sandwhich, and not overly expensive. Like the other reviews, the best thing is that they're roasting these turkeys all day. They use good materials (bread, vegetables and cheese) unlike our neighboorhood Subway. The people that work here are really cool too. Its also earning 4 stars because its literally 10 feet from my apt. 

Arguello Super Market, as the market, is not so good. I'd give it a 3 star rating, just cuz its close and convenient. But how does the place stay open until 8pm only? We need a place that sells beer until 1 am! I know there are other liquor stores around, but I really hoped that this could be "my store." The stuff at this place is also pretty expensive, which is the norm for the small-guy shops in the city. Anyways, i gave it a four becuase of its bomb ass sandwhich. It also gets props for providing the homeless dude with an awning so that he doesn't get wet when sleeping in the rain.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Overpriced "famous" sandwiches and overpriced groceries. Well that's what Sal has to do in order to keep his business alive. I also hear hes one cheap bastard when it comes to his employees.

I've lived around this neighborhood the past 20 years and nothing has changed. It sure is convenient to get a drink or a head of lettuce, but thats about it. The yuppies and college students flock to this place since they don't mind spending a few extra dollars or their parent's money. For me, I'll stop by after work to get a soda if I run out at home. Who remembers "Rocko" who used to work here? He was there for like 10 years.

It's a good place for the neighborhood people who need a a quart of milk or a loaf of bread. Anything else, you are better off getting some exercise while you walk to Safeway on 7th Ave.
author: SF N.

description:
Great. Now I have a f'ing turkey sandwich addiction. Thank you.
Since I started coming to the Arguello Super Market a few weeks ago, no matter what I have for lunch, I would rather have an Arguello turkey sandwich. 

Thanks to my thrice weekly white meat turkey on dutch crunch with avocado, I'm now Miss Tight Jeans, even in my loose jeans.

Even though this place and it's demon sandwiches has wrecked my I haven't seen my ex-boyfriend in 4 years and now that I'm going to see him next month I have to weigh nothing summer diet, I would give it 7 seven stars if I could: 
1 extra for having W Magazine at the checkout
and 1 extra for stocking baked flaming hot Cheetos .
author: stephanie c.

description:
Everyone always writes about the "famous" turkey sandwich, and with good reason.  Get it with cranberry and it's just like Thanksgiving at Grandma's, but without the awkward conversation.

The other sandwich options are just as good, and usually massive.  You can get a prosciutto sandwich, generally an expensive choice, for about the same cost as any of the other sandwiches.  And it's real good.  I'm a dutch crunch fan and they do it well.

The standard deli fair (p salad, dolma, etc) is average in taste and a bit expensive in cost, but the sandwiches more than make up for it.  Groceries are, as you probably suspected, expensive.  The staff is cordial but not overly friendly.  They get busy during lunch so set aside at least 15 minutes for waiting.

When you crave a sandwich or fond Thanksgiving memories hit up Arguello Super Market.
author: Kyle J.

description:
It was a dark and rainy night when I was walking down Arguello contemplating dinner and the idea of going to the newly opened Safeway and walking home in the rain with groceries sounded unappealing.  When a beacon of light  from the windows of the Arguello Super Market crossed my path.  

I passed this market a few times during the daytime, but never had a reason to venture in until now.  Thankfully, this is not an oversized corner liquor store.  It is a really good market.

I found organic mixed greens, cucumbers, broccoli, dairy, fruit, glossy foodie and fashion magazines, and the deli looks to quite sizable too.  And they are open late enough that I can leave work, run multiple errands, and still have enough time to grocery shop before they close their doors for the night.

Wait, wait  there is already an update.  This is not a really good market it is a SUPER market.  The magazine rack doesn't just include foodie, fashion, and gossip mags....gasp I spotted BUST and ReadyMade.  Well you ain't gonna find BUST at Safeway.  That does it.  I am going to make a concerted effort to shop at Arguello Super Market.  Even if it is just to pick up a magazine and a sandwich.  ( I hear the turkey sandwiches are delish)
author: Amy M.

description:
World Famous Turkey Sandwich how I miss you!  

Tender, juicy, fresh carved turkey meat (you can pick white or dark meat) every possible thing you might ever want to put on it, and a solid drink selection render this market the bomb. 

Get a sandwich, a drink and go to the park on a sunny day- what could be better?
author: Katelyn S.

description:
Market be damned, inside this building is the best turkey sandwich in the bay area. Mm hm, read it right. Big ups to my cousins for the tipoff.

Get there before 2:00 pm.You just go to the deli counter, and you'll notice around 5 turkeys cooking in rotisserie ovens on either side. If you order at the right moment, they'll carry your slice of bread over to the bird and just CARVE GLISTENING MEAT ONTO IT. Cranberry sauce. 

You're looking at about 6 bucks. 1 sandwich will get you pretty full, but you could take down 2. Serving these with fresh stuffing would really fuck me up emotionally.
author: Abby M.

description:
Great little dessert table how you tempt me.
Big turkey sandwich how I crave you.
Have you seen the tamales?
Tried the fresh veggies?
It's all so goooooood...

the pupusas in the back are moldy, ew, but give them a break, who in the Inner Richmond even knows what a pupusa is... well you should! But that is besides the point. I am glad I live around the corner.
author: Lee M.

description:
Arguello makes good sandwiches.  Not fancy, not superb, but good.  Its just a regular deli sandwich, that happens to be pretty large.  Don't go in here expecting a sandwich that will dazzle your tastebuds, because it wont happen.  But if you expect a good sandwich thats slightly expensive you won't be disappointed.  

Negatives:  at lunch time there is a long line, which really sucks.  The sandwiches are kinda overpriced.  Not enough to make me freak out or stop eating there, but more than I like to pay for an okay sandwich no matter how big it is.  The store has always had a weird odor to me.  But apparently it doesn't bother me that much as I'm still eating there.
author: Isi C.

description:
Finally made it inside this place after walking by it and reading the sign "Home of the famous rotisserie turkey sandwich!" (something like that).  Went here to get some grub before playing The Go Game.  I didn't realize how nice this market was...tons of fresh fruit and veggies and a great deli with lots of sandwich options and pasta salads etc.

I stuck with what they are famous for, the turkey sandwich and got it on dutch crunch.  Overall it was a tasty sandwich and very reasonably priced...just $5.99!  I was a bit disappointed to find that the dutch crunch roll wasn't all that crunchy.  The roof of my mouth thanked me though.

Next time I'm near my buddies place I think I'll try the hot pastrami!
author: Christopher W.

description:
Everyone else boast about the turkey, but I have a biased opinion. Before I even knew they had turkey, I always went for the chicken. Can't beat a fresh cooked chicken sandwich (rotisserie)!!! They even carve it right in front of you, and you choose dark/white meat. You really can't beat that.

The park is right down the street too. Great place to grab a sandwich, and go sit in the park =).
author: Charles K.

description:
Summary:
Price: Slightly above average
Food: Above average


The sandwich is pretty decent. Though I wouldnt say its a MUST TRY or you will die kinda thing. But if you live around arguello, its a good place to go for quick lunch or simple dinner.
author: Jolin L.

description:
The fact that I'm just two doors away is a major incentive to patronize Arguello Market, especially when I'm in my "slug" mood.  Plus, I TRY to do my best to support my neighborhood grocery store whenever and however I can. However, I must admit that if I were closer to the Safeway on 7th, I think it'd cut down my Arguello visits by 75%. 

Prices are definitely higher.  I'm not complaining - I know it's a necessary move to compete with these corporate monsters.  But hey, I like monsters...I love Sulley & Mike...and I love my produce fresh (which it sometimes is not), selection vast, and .prices low.

As Arguello Super Market definitely serves a niche in my life, I'm still going to frequent occasionally for their scrumptious turkey sandwiches, their 3 for $5.00 Vitamin Water deals, and when the TP levels hit critical.
author: Gerrick O.

description: This is a review only for the freshly carved turkey sandwich on dutch crunch! I love it...word to the wise, call ahead. This place is much loved by everyone and you will wait for at least 20 minutes to get your sandwich! (20 minutes that are worth it!)
author: Alisa S.

description:
Delicious Turkey sandwiches! Enough to feed two people or one very hungry glutton. This place is a slam dunk for lunch, and the secret is out- there's usually a long line of construction workers and neighborhood randoms like me who are "working from home."

The people are really nice too, and Sal the manager is usually around taking care of business. They had a taxi crash into their front window and now the whole place has been remodeled with nice wide aisles and a good produce area up front. Good generic granola too.
author: Dan B.

description: Best fresh turkey sandwich in the city.  Fresh, delicious, and moist.  Love it with the works, including cranberries.  All for $6!!
author: Kailee Q.

description: Sal, the owner, has really upgraded and expanded both the selection and quality of items in his market over the years.  A real blessing for the neighborhood.   Great sandwiches and friendly, dedicated staff.
author: Glenn D.

description: Too expensive. That and nothing special in terms of food. Not much of a produce department either. The Deli is alright, but nothing special. Better deals at the Safeway on 7th ave.
author: Alex H.

description:
Really yummy hot turkey breast sandwiches can be found here!
But beware of the sandwich makers who seldom get your order right.
Also, if you're a pickle afficionada like myself, make darn sure that you ask for some pickles on the side too! This place for some unknown reason rations pickles so on the average, you get only a quarter thin slice of pickle per half sandwich! Shocking and unnecessary!
author: Sara K.

description:
Not huge, just a couple of long aisles, but has all your basic groceries and produce. I fell in love when I ate their freshly carved dark meat turkey sandwich, still warm when I got home. A decent prosciutto sandwich, too.

You can pay by debit, but it's really slow, and then you feel guilty for holding up the line.
author: Stacy J.

description:
I always knew that my first review would be of Arguello Super and more importantly, their WORLD FAMOUS fresh roasted turkey sandwiches. Since I live a block away from Arguello, I make it a habit to get the turkey sandwich (dark meat on wheat, no mayo, with cranberry and swiss cheese and when they ask about salt and pepper, i say YES) every weekend. If I don't get my fix of the turkey sandwich, I go through withdrawal. 

I also have to note that they have not one, not two, but THREE kinds of potato salad (San Francisco, creole, & potato and egg) that are oh so delicious. 

I am ADDICTED.
author: Patrick L.

description:
This would be the perfect store to have on the corner of your block because you would always be able to run out for staple items at the last minute. However, I found it a little challenging to do all of my grocery shopping here between the fairly steep prices and the lack of selection in some areas. I like that it's an independent market, but I don't think I could afford to do serious shopping here.

I did think that their fruit looked great though. This area was well-stocked and the bananas I bought were some of the best I've eaten. 

I will definitely be back to try out the sandwiches as my fellow yelpers have suggested.

No hard feelings, Arguello, see you around sometime. . .
author: Katy W.

description:
Great sandwiches! They rotisserize 5-6 turkeys a day on the weekends, and the turkey & cranberry sauce sandwich looks to reign supreme here. I never order it but I'm sure it's de-lish. 

The market just recently got a nice, little makeover. They changed the layout of the place, looks like they got new fridges, and looks like they carry some cute boutique-y brands. The best part? It's about 20 yards from our front door. 

Great place to get a lunch to go for a picnic in GG park just a minute away!
author: Jen P.

description: Best Sandwiches I've had in the city...Yes the best turkey sandwich, make sure to add avo or cran, or a REALLY good pastrami sandwich as well. $6 Can't go wrong.
author: Elliott J.

description:
Oh fresh turkey sandwich, how I dream of you!!
I did have to give it a second try after misordering the first go of it.  My reco would be sourdough, everything else, cheese can go either way and pepperchinis (I cant spell).  NO pepper!
Beware of too much pepper though!
author: S M.

description: Ohh man these sandwiches are pretty amazing.  My sister introduced me to the turkey sandwich and it was good. My dad told me to get half white meat and half dark to keep the sandwich moist and not dry.  You can also add avocados and cranberry sauce.  I recommend adding the cranberry sauce it makes it taste like left over thanksgiving dinner.  Too bad it doesn't have gravy or stuffing.  Haha I'm getting a little carried away.
author: Kendal T.

description: Arguello Super is a great sammich place, but the lines are insane. The turkey with cranberry is my favorite but truly everything there is great and because it is a super market you can get almost anything you need for a picnic in the park. Great place for a sunny day lounging in the park.
author: Sean MC E.

description: I'm thankful that this store exists in the neighborhood.  Overall it has nice products and the store is very clean.  Its expensive but you can find quality products like crackers, chocolate and fruit that ordinarily you would have to go to an expensive store like whole foods to find.  I will gladly pay a little more convenience of a small store.
author: Bryan P.

description: The bag says "Home of the world famous turkey sandwich." It just is. When I worked in San Francisco this was at least a weekly (if not more) place to visit. The turkey sandwich is phenomenal and always feels carefully crafted by the nice folks behind the counter. I wish I still lived half a block away from this place. The owners are also very wonderful people and take an unbelievable amount of pride in their store. I wish there were more places like this.
author: Garrett C.

description:
Everyone is talking about their turkey sandwiches...

But I love their piroshki and calzones!

Their piroshki are like meat, onion, and cheese DOUGHNUTS and their calzones are super stuffed with all kinds of great things.  I got both for $6!!

4/5 since the guy at the check out stand glares at you like you're stealing things, even when you just want some food.
author: Gavin S.

description:
When a friend pointed me here, I had my doubts.  A grocery store deli?  For the best sandwich around?  Are you sure?

Despite my doubts, I went anyway, and I knew I made the right choice when I saw the deli man plunge into a huge roasting oven, pulling out a plump, luscious leg of a freshly roasted turkey.  He even asked me whether I wanted light or dark meat, and he wasn't shy with the portions.  

The turkey was still warm, people.  (I did a double take:  "Is it November?! Warm turkey sandwich?!")

So yes, it's all that and a bag of chips.  Quite literally, if you pick up some chips.
author: Ann M.

description:
Home of the Famous Turkey sandwich. And yes it's very tasty. They keep the turkey roasting in a rotisserie grill. Get it on the Dutch Crunch bread, you won't regret it.

The grocery store is definitely more expensive than the usual places (Lucky's, Safeway, Trader Joe's).
author: Helena H.

description:
It wasn't a while ago that a car smashed into the front of this market... and since then, this place has renovated both inside and outside.   New and improved.  

Although I don't usually get my groceries here, I do come here once in a while to pick up something quick.  On my way picking up a carton of milk this morning, I somehow lingered a little longer along the isles.  To my surprise,  this place is transferring to be a mini-Whole Foods.  Viccolo's pizza, Mighty Leaf's teas, illy coffee beans, and a nice section of gourmet chocolates, just to name a few things that you can now find at this little market...  There is also a table up front where you can find awesome goods from Just Desserts and other local bakeries.  And the best surprise is when I spotted a bottle of cava pino noir brut, one that I read about in a wine magazine a few months ago and I couldn't find anywhere else, for $15.  

Definitely a neighborhood jewel.
author: Shirley F.

description:
The rotisserie chicken and turkey are delicious.
The grocery prices are reasonable.
However, the employees are grumpy and disregard the customer. 

Where's the friendly neighborhood *smile* in Arguello?
author: Hannah R.

description:
Yes, the turkey sandwich is good. 

But, seriously it wasn't to die-for good, like Roxie's. 
The turkey is good, the dutch crunch is awesome. Toasted would made it way better. The prices are good (like 5.49 for the turkey sandwich).

Am I blind or are there no chips, you know Doritos, Lay's that kinda thing.
Sure, I'll go back.
author: Chili B.

description:
5 stars because, hand's down, they have to make the best sandwiches in all of San Francisco. And I wouldn't say that if I really didn't like it. 

Oh man, they use fresh roasted turkey, piled high on your choice of bread. Its a considerably big sandwich and once you're done with it, any ravaging hunger beast in your belly will be satiated, hands down. Be it from its made deliciousness or the tryptophane in the turkey, who knows, its just freaken good. 

As for the groceries, its sort of like a boutique grocery shop (I don't know the actual word you'd use), but there are alot of quality goods there that you can trust with your brain, maybe not so much with your wallet. Be prepared to go heavy on your wallet with the stuffs you buy....it'll rack up. 

But definitely go here for the sandwiches, if not the goods there. I promise you, you will NOT be sorry. 6 bucks well well well wellll spent.
author: Dzu N.

description:
I walked past this place the other day, saw the sign for "famous turkey sandwiches" and talked my bf into going the next day for late lunch.  I was soooo looking forward to a fresh turkey sandwich.  

The first problem - THEY DIDN'T HAVE ANY OF THE FRESH TURKEY THEY'RE SUPPOSEDLY FAMOUS FOR.  The guy at the counter said the only thing they had was sliced deli meat.  So, as I was trying to figure out what to have in its place,  my bf ordered a chicken calzone and fruit salad.  I figured out which sandwich I was going to order, and as our server came back with the calzone, I tried to place my order.  He ignored me,  walked to the back of the deli, took off his uniform, came out, grabbed the tip jar, and clocked out.  As all the other servers were occupied with customers, I said "to hell with it let's go pay".  The man at the register appeared to be a manager, and I mentioned that I wouldn't be coming back due to the bad service.  He just  looked at me obtusely. 

We headed to the park to munch on the calzone.  It was ok.  The bread is homemade, but kind of chewy and bland.  The filling was average, not especially flavorful and kind of sparse in quantity.  If you just want to fill some space for not a lot of $, you could do worse, assuming you can get someone to take your order.  If it's time for their break and they're in the middle of making your sandwich, I expect you'll have to wait for it until they come back.
author: G.L. B.

description: Definitely the best sandwiches in town!  I crave them.  But the sandwich making is  a little slow...I was third in line and it took 25 minutes to get may sandwiches.  I love you guys, but maybe add another sandwich maker or two during lunch hour xo.
author: Mary B.

description:
Because of all the turkey reviews on yelp, i had to try the bird on a dutchcrunch with everything including cranberry sauce. That was 3 weeks ago and i've just been back for sandwich number 3. Believe me, it is one FINE sandwich.
try it, you'll like it!
author: chris m.

description:
My cousins live a block away, and this place has been our savior (Note: It's recently undergone a fantastic renovation). 

Anywho, as Susan mentions, Turkey is king @ Arguello. The roasted Turkey is fantastic, and I love combining the dark and white meat on The Dutch Crunch Roll. 

They also have GREAT Dolmas and Hummus. Good Calzones. And just the fact that they have Piroshkis are awesome 

The groceries, however, are a little pricey compared to Safeway or Trader Joes (tempted to dock a point, but I like them a lot
author: Navid N.

description:
The best sandwiches in San Francisco.  I've moved away from this area since leaving school, but I will always come back here for the sandwiches.  Some of my friends lived less than a block from here, so picking up a sandwich before heading to their place was perfect.  Then they moved.  And I tried to find new friends in the area (well, not entirely true, but I still come back for the sandwiches).

It's a small grocery store, and may be a little pricey, but it's not a supermarket, so you have to know what to expect.  However, again, my point is that their deli is AWESOME.  Do yourself a favor, and try it.  I doubt you'll be disappointed if you like a good deli sandwich, and you can just walk to the park to enjoy it by the Conservatory of Flowers if you want to eat it outside.  I actually want one now.
author: Chris M.

description: Would that there would be more and more Arguello Supers in the city (world). This is a down-home yet fully stocked local grocery store. They rarely make 'em like this anymore. It has a great deli, so many delish picnic type food options, along with all the staples with some basic organic staples to boot. The owner, Sal is an all-around swell guy. Goooooooooooooooo Arguello; you are really SUPER!!!!!!
author: Janice H.

description:
As many other reviewers have said, the freshly carved turkey sandwiches at the Arguello super market are second to none.  The turkey with cranberry sauce on dutch crunch from Arguello I could eat every day for the rest of my life and be happy.   One reminder: I think the deli closes around 6:30pm.

In terms of being a supermarket, though, they are pretty expensive and my cheap ass would much rather go to Safeway or Trader Joe's.
author: Rishi K.

description:
This is my sister's corner store (she doesn't own it or anything) and she always telling me about the rotisserie turkey sandwiches.  She loves them like a crackhead loves...well, crack.  I tried one.  She's right again.  They run in the $6 range and you can choose white meat or dark, what kind of bread or roll, and what kind of cheese.  Very simple, but very delicious.  If you catch them at the right time, you can get first cut of a fresh turkey (this phenomenon is referred to as "being in the zone" and is rare).  I know nothing about the market itself, it looked a little trendy, and with the neighborhood it's in, it would stand to reason that they're a little over-priced.

But their turkey is the BOMB
author: Garrett C.

description: ASM does not make you wait till thanksgiving to have a tasty turkey sandwich. Nice slow roasted bird that keeps people waiting in line. I try to avoid this place during the weekend as I hate to wait in long lines but rather go during the week. Service is also very friendly from the first time I stepped into the market everyone has been all smiles.
author: David G.

description: Love the sandwiches. I switch on and off between the roasted chicken sandwich, salami, or roast beef sandwich, but always get the dutch crunch roll. AMAZING. Never get tired of eating sandwiches there. Try it out! It's worth it.
author: Carissa E.

description: Arguello's roasted turkey sandwich on crunch sourdough is one of the best. They roast their own turkey daily and as a result it comes out in thick, tender slices that make you feel like it the day after Thanksgiving all year round. They also have a good selection for a small market and saves you the trouble of tackling the Safeway monster down the street or heading to Mollie Stone's for your Straus Family milk.
author: Rebecca D.

description: Worth every star just for their turkey sandwich. It definitely lives up to its world famous billing. Haven't found a better warm turkey sandwich in the city yet!
author: Ajay K.

description: Great little local grocery with surprisingly competitive prices.  I love their sandwiches too.  The Turkey Sandwich is delicious, though it will make you sleepy.  I also recommend the veggie sandwich which at $4.99 will make your tummy and your wallet very happy.
author: Sage S.

description:
I love this market for its neighborhood feel and nice selection. I've lived nearby for three years and the owner has always been very friendly - he and the staff know my name and are helpful whenever I have questions. It's much more personal than either Safeway or Lucky, and the store contributes a lot to the feel of our tiny neighborhood.

It's a little pricey for items like cereal and milk, but they have great selection on harder-to-find items like Bob's Red Mill flours and cooking grains like barley and farro. They also have a well-curated magazine rack and sidewalk tables for sunny days.  All in all, very convenient for one-off purchases, I'm glad it's here.
author: Meg B.

description: Turkey sandwich - best in SF. I ate about 100 of these when I lived in the neighborhood.
author: Mike S.

description: Who knew a little tucked away market would have such delicious sandwiches?  I haven't really bought anything else here so this review is purely for their deli sandwiches.  I love how you can have all the staple meats like ham, salami, prosciutto, etc. but you can also have fresh oven-roasted turkey or rotisserie chicken.  And all for a fantastic price and great service!
author: Maya G.

description: This review is strictly for their Turkey Sandwich- AMAZING. this is by far the best turkey sandwich i have ever had the privelige to put in my belly. First off,  the turkey as moist as it can get, the Dutch Crunch (the only bread i get) is buttery and flaky yet durable. they use deli mustard which is key not to overpower the flavor of the turkey, and I recomend Cranberry sauce to make it like the full expeience. My mouth is watering just writing this review. There is something powerful about this sandwich, that makes me urn for it everytime i drive by the market (which is daily).
author: Josh B.

description: They should have a sign outside reading "No Kids Allowed" I have lived in the neighborhood and shopped at Arguello Super for 10 years. In the past I have let little annoyances go by the wayside. Today I took my last trip to their market. I have 3 boys ages 9,7, and 5. They were followed around the market and told repeatedly not to touch. Don't touch the buttons on the lottery vending machine, don't touch the produce scales, don't touch the ...... on and on. Nothing they touched was dangerous to them or others nor was it breakable. I have been taking my well behaved kids to super markets all their lives and have never been treated that way. I don't mind going out of my way a few blocks to not have to deal with that. Very rude and disrespectful. Come on, kids are people too.
author: Corrine A.

description: Alright, this place is pretty good. I've been coming here for a while and you can't argue with fresh roasted chicken and turkey. I don't really use the market much but they have a good selection and fair prices. I love the deli though. 6.50 for a fresh turkey or chicken sando with avo and cheese, nothing wrong with that!
author: Parker H.

description:
Great little market.  A throwback, if you will.  The turkey sandwhiches draw a crowd, deservedly so.  For a small place, they have great selection.  That sounds strange, but what I mean is you can get virtually any kind of food there.  spanish, kosher, irish, italian...whatever.

Get yourself a sandwhich and sit outside in the shade, hang with the walkers and thier pooches.
author: Nathan Z.

description: The stakes are high when you claim that your turkey sandwich is the "world's best." Sure it may come off pretentious, but it's not far off from the truth. Arguello Super is a little market with a mean deli selection. The freshly-carved turkey is tender and perfectly roasted, and tastes amazing on a dutch crunch roll. It reminds me of my Mom's Thanksgiving turkey sandwiches when leftovers are almost better than the day before. A great spot for the Richmond locals, and a trip well worth trekking for the rest of us. Two thumbs up for an awesome sandwich and an equally amazing tryptophan effect Saturday siesta.
author: Alex H.

description: I am not the biggest fan of Turkey, but the fresh rotisserie turkey sandwich is soo good. Always on the hunt to find a good sandwich in the neighborhood, I had been told about this place by a couple friends. I finally went and tried it and it is definitely worth the hype. Fresh roasted turkey with avacado and pepper jack cheese... *drool* Watch out for bones though, I have discovered them in sandwiches. Small price to pay for turkey carved directly from the bird to your sandwich.
author: Troy K.

description:
I do love the sandwiches here, but mostly use Arguello as my neighborhood market.  Bought a happy turkey here for Thanksgiving, buy my Clover milk here (Safeway doesn't carry it), and usually they have great deals on fruit.

Four stars for the quality of local, organic, happy meat and vegis, but an additional star for the service.  I always receive excellent service here, but today (I'm 9 months pregnant), the cashier took my groceries, without asking me, to my car.  Made me cry a little.
author: r t.

description:
The best fresh, pulled turkey and chicken sandwiches going!  Fresh meat and good bread choices.  Their sides like creole potato salad, cole slaw are pretty good.

As a store, it is priced like a gourmet shop (less than say Adronico) but does have reasonably-priced produce.  They have a good variety and they are constantly getting new products and keeping them in stock gourmet cookies, coconut water, and other current buzz products.  The owner and staff are super nice and accommodating.  Helps that it is down the street from me house.

The Turkey Sandwich absolutely rocks and is heralded by SF Magazine and many others.  Think I will go there right now!
author: Lo F.

description: I have eaten so many delicious sandwiches here! I used to live right by here and if you're a neighborhood local, then you know about these sandwiches.  Dutch Crunch turkey sandwich is what I always used to get with fresh avocado.  And if you get the right guy, he'll hook it up with tons of avocado, which I love!  They are fast and right around $7-8. Even a sitting area inside and outside if you can't wait until you get home ;)
author: Courtney M.

description: Excellent location steps from my place. This market is insanely convenient for grabbing last minute things, though I wouldn't necessarily do all my grocery shopping here. Prices are reasonable, especially compared to stores like Andronicos. I've had their veggie sub and it wasn't bad, I didn't like their dutch crunch roll, Ike's is where it's at.
author: Cori W.

description:
For many, many years, Arguello Super Market has been my go-to for the World's Best Turkey Sandwich - on a Dutch Crunch roll.  No longer true -
it has fallen from grace with a thud.
Where's the Turkey?  There was half the turkey that once was - and my second half of the sandwich had one thin slice - barely turkey.  I am so bummed.  It's NOT the World's Best Turkey Sandwich any longer.
author: Geri S.

description: Best Roasted Turkey Sandwich in the City!!!! You better get there before they run out!
author: Adam L.

description: Hands down the best sandwich I've had in San Francisco.   Enormous fresh roasted whole turkeys spin slowly on a spit as you contemplate your order, and the guys there carve your meat right off of them.   These guys are sandwich-making savants.  Go for the $7.95 "box lunch #1", which includes a turkey sandwich, any salad, cookie, fruits, and a 12 oz. soda.  The potato salads are amazing, especially the creole.  Go for the dutch crunch, and add fresh avocado.  Grab your box lunch, sit at one of the small tables located on the wide sidewalk, soak up the sun and feel lucky to be alive.  This place made law school a whole helluva lot more bearable.  Long live Arguello Market.
author: Dan L.

description: This market is the best! the best turkey sandwich I ever had. They have very good and healthy products.
author: Lyle C.

description: I used to live down the street from here and I love this place! I didn't really do my shopping here because it was a little expensive, but they get 5 stars for their deli. Get the boxed lunch... it's literally lunch and dinner for under $10.00. The turkey sandwich is great and super fresh!
author: Daryah N.

description: I love that world famous turkey sandwiches live next me. They are delicious but when I want for lunch the line is out the door and I usually just avoid it and pick something else up to eat.
author: Elisa M.

description: Hand-carved turkey on whole wheat with the works: A little overpriced, but the perfect meal & it really hit the spot post-Bay to Breakers. A buddy of mine lives around the corner from this joint, so between the Arguello Market & Cafe Velo Rouge, I'm having some serious 'hood establishment envy right about now.
author: Pete J.

description: Arguello Super is not known for its grocery store.  Heck, I don't even go there for groceries.  Super's "World Famous" turkey sandwiches are one of the tastiest things you will ever consume.  The bread and ingredients are as fresh as can be.  You can see the whole turkeys cooking behind the counter.  The sandwich-making masters cut the turkey fresh just for you.  They pack meat inside the sandwich until its literally overflowing with goodness.  They have plenty of great condiments such as jalapenos and avocados.  I always get a turkey sandwich on their amazing dutch crunch with everything. Their chicken salad is also incredible.  Everyone must taste an Arguello Super sandwich before death.
author: Scott G.

description: Monkey thought the turkey sandwiches were so good, he wanted to vomit when he was finished so he could enjoy the experience again. Please recycle.
author: Monkey B.

description: I love this place.  I don't know why I haven't reviewed it earlier since I've practically lived next door to it for about 3 years.  We all know about the Turkey sandwiches and that the prices on other items are pricey but reasonable, but I really love the level of service that you get.  The staff is really nice and after a while they get to be like family, they are always asking about your family and friends that they see you come into the store with, it's great..  Classic Mom & Pop.
author: Nick L.

description: WRONG!! everybody who says this place has the most kick ass roast turkey sandwiches is wrong. aside from the turkey being fresh there is zero to say about the sandwich. it's a decent sandwich but the turkey isn't anything special. i intended to be wowed but that didn't happen.
author: Regina C.

description: As much as I like to reap the benefits of my Safeway card, my conscience feels much better shopping at this great mom and pop store.  I can get most things I need and their deli is great!  Plus, now that I'm a regular the owners recognize me and it makes me feel like I'm in a small town market.  The 5 minute walk from my house doesn't hurt either.  Shop local.
author: Krista C.

description: Hands down the best turkey sandwhich in the City!  Dutch crunch is the way to go.  make sure to get jalapenos too
author: Scott L.

description:
oh yea the owner is such a nice guy here!!! oh yea i love all the peeeeeeeeeps here.  sounds like a bunch of "who know's it's" that eat here.  the sandwiches are modest at best.  crummy bread, boring vegetables, and shit fuck cheese.  not to mention, i found a fucking feather in my "roast chicken sandwich!!!!!"  yea no joke, a serious feather. so besides that making this place a shithole, don't fall for everyone's stupid hype over this dumb place... at least go to a place where they treat you well.  these people are rude and the most unfriendly people in all showbiz!!!  fuck arguello super and let it be the only spot in san francisco to burn to the ground when the geart quake hits!!!!!!!

"i have but only one request... let the bro-unit burn!!!"
--bruce bochy (2007)
author: John B R.

description: Turkey sandwich, cranberry - everything you need in life. The only thing I will purchase from the market...what's with home boy at the check-out? Asshole.
author: Paul R.

description: Grew up in the neighborhood and have been going to Arguello super for the past 15 years for its convenience. I definitely recommend the turkey or roast beef sandwhich on dutch crunch roll.... mmm just delicious. They also have one of the freshest produce. I want to give it four stars but my dad bought a pricey New York steak that was just terrible and Sal wouldn't refund his money. He vowed to never return again.
author: Michael T.

description: Nice local supermarket that has deli sandwiches. I got a roast beef and very tasty. Filling sandwich. Good service, but price a little bit pricey.
author: Leon C.

description: Big fat turkey sandwhich, on a day not after thanksgiving? I never even liked turkey sandwhiches before this place. None of the staff look especially friendly and the guys behind the corner always seem to be scowling but damn that turkey sandwhich is good.
author: Jon S.

description:
Ah, yes. Life has taken precedent and I have neglected my fellow Yelpers. But, today I came across this fine little establishment and couldn't help but review it out of pure enjoyment. 
Aside from the grocery store, if you find yourself in the inner richmond district for whatever reason, and are craving a quick and tasty lunch, this is the place. Don't be fooled by it's appearance as a typical supermarket deli, as this far exceeds ANYTHING you could ever have the minimum wagers behind the counter at Lucky's or Safeway concoct for you. 
I ordered the Turkey Sandwich on Dutch Crunch in the "Arguello box lunch." As you will see, they constantly have whole turkeys doing the 360 degree rotisserie dance on the rotisserie and that is the turkey they put in the sandwiches. As they were making my sandwich, I watched them freshly carve slices off of a whole turkey and slap them right down on the fresh slice of dutch crunch that would later become my sandwich. Along with the fresh condiments, the sandwich was truly amazing. In addition, in the Arguello box lunch deal, they give you an orange slice, an apple alice, an Oreo, and your choice of a variety of side salads. I chose the pesto pasta salad which was fresh and tasty with clearly thought out preparation. There were a number of other delicious looking pasta salads that I will most definitely test  on my assured future visits. Although I ate the entire meal in one sitting (in the quaint but convenient sitting area inside and outside of the supermarket), I could have easily stopped after the first half of the sandwich and still been satisfied with my level of fullness. So, needless to say, they give you a a lot of food.  Although it is a little pricey compared to a five dollar foot-long, I guarantee you the extra few bucks you spend are surely worth your time and effort....depending on how long it takes you to earn that money at your place of employment. 
Don't be fooled by this review and think that a turkey sandwich is all you can get because there are a TON of other items on the menu that I am sure are equally delectable. So, try the turkey or try something else, but definitely try Arguello Super Market!
author: Cody S.

description: Living in the neighborhood, I'm a fan of the supermarket and it's location.  It has a fairly decent selection given it's size, and even though most of the items are a little on the pricey side, I almost always prefer to shop here over the nearby Safeway.  That said, I think the turkey sandwich, while good, isn't as good as it's hyped to be (though still definitely worth it's value) and even though I've been going here over a year, the owner (or manager?) of the store has never been especially friendly.
author: l k.

description:
its all been said before:  get an effin turkey sandwich.
you'll be glad you did.  they carve the turkey right in front of you! 

 if i was nora ephron i would write a movie about meg ryan and tom hanks falling in love with this sandwich.
author: clever u.

description: i use to live next door to this place.  I found myself in here all the time.  This place makes awesome sandwiches and the owner is a really nice guy.  If you're near this place you owe it to yourself to go in here and get a sandwich.
author: doug b.

description: Their rotisserie turkey sandwich is SOOOO good.  It makes me want to do a happy dance, with my hands up in the air.  They let you pick dark or white meat.  I always pick the dark meat (more cancer, but juicier).  So you can choose the white meat and leave the rest of the bird to me.  I rub it in my friend's face every time I get it because I got her hooked on it and she lives nowhere near it (sucker!).
author: Ronald T.

description: AMAZING sandwitches... a great spot if your in the area. generally very short lines. very old school supermarket feel
author: Andrew D.

description: I love the Arguello Market because I live around the corner from it, and they have a very nice selection of items.  Their produce is especially nice.  Of course I pay 2-3 times what I'd pay at Safeway, but that's what I get for being too lazy to drive somewhere for cheaper groceries.  I don't , however, get the excitement over the turkey sandwiches here - every time I've tried to order them, they've always run out of white meat and have only ragged pieces of dark meat left...  Plus the line at the deli counter is always super slow.  Wish they took AmEx...
author: kate g.

description: My nice little neighborhood market that has a MEAN deli section!  Great turkey sandos perfect for taking over the hill and with some friends and noshin' in front of the Conservatory, and the rest of the store is pretty expansive.  The prices are quite high, but that's what I expect at a place like this... get your real shopping done at TJs!
author: Cooper S.

description: This is the place to get what may very possibly be the best turkey sandwich in the entire universe.
author: Matt O.

description: I'm a super fan of the rotisserie turkey sandwhiches,  two friends (of extremely different backgrounds and styles) both recommended the place for their turkey sandwhiches and they weren't lying... so tasty!!!  MMMMMMMmmmmmmmm I'm salivating just thinking about 'em ~ too bad I don't live closer! I only gave them a 4 as I don't have any other knowledge of the place but would definitely recommend that everyone try their turkey sandwhiches!
author: Juli B.

description: I think this place is super cute and spacious. My husband said the prices where higher than he expected, but I've found them to be generally reasonable. The turkey sandwiches are super tasty; I'd highly recommend them. We keep meaning to pack a picnic and stop by this place on the way to the park; there's all kinds of nicey picnic-type foods.
author: H H.

description: I live across the street and i wouldn't know what I'd do without this place. Sal is always there to help or special order cookie dough for me. Jose makes an awesome fresh chicken sandwich with fresh cranberry sauce you could ever ask for.  I only with they were open later than 8.
author: nina B.

description: Fresh roasted turkey sandwich (with mayo). That is all you need from Arguello Super Market. It recently changed hands, but the sandwiches are still good.
author: Judy L.

description:
F Subway, this place has the best sandwiches in the city for 6 bucks. 

With a santas workshop of messicans behind the counter, this place pumps out the best hot turkey sandwiches for the price EVER. Five stars. Fast
author: Cam K.

description:
they have irish sweeties!

i always get eye-deed, which i find flattering!

yay arguello!
author: Juan C.

description: Me and my boyfriend are pretty much regulars here.  Turkey sandwich on dutch crunch, white meat, swiss cheese, and extra pickles. Thanks to yelp, I have found a GREAT sandwich place in the city that is not too far from my place. The fresh, hot turkey is super delicious, along with every single ingredient the sandwich comes in. We always find ourselves back here pretty often because we keep wanting more. 5 stars says you'll definitely be satisfied!
author: mae e.

description: The owners are nice people, folks.  We should know, one of their kids went to the same school, same class with our kid.  My ex-work place occasionally got  food catered for lunch meetings from them.  Their hot lunches, especially pasta were particularly good.  Personally, I like their deli potato salad.  It's so good. Yum.  Their sandwiches are OK.  Not easy to find parking in the area.
author: Ry T.

description: Some things in here are overpriced, but generally everything is pretty reasonable for it being such a small grocery store. Arguello Super gets four stars though for their friendly staff! Also, my boyfriend loves loves loves the turkey sandwich.
author: Emily F.

description: There is only ONE REASON WHY I GO HERE---- the turkey sandwich, made with fresh roasted hot turkey right out the oven. It is the best Turkey sandwich I have ever had and recommend everyone try it.  Make sure they put some cranberry sauce on it!
author: James M.

description: I've had the pleasure of living only a block from this great locally-owned little grocery. They have just about everything you need, including a great cheese section...and plenty of wines to choose from as well. The best part about this place is the deli--the guys make THE BEST turkey sandwich in the city...any way you want it, I get half-and-half--dark and white meat--and everyone who works there is incredibly sweet! They're involved in the community and they care about you...love it!
author: Nicole S.

description:
i miss my thrice weekly turkey sandwiches - ordered on a sourdough baguette, it is somewhere between 1 and 2 meals with a bag of chips, so i guess it would be better to order it on bread, save myself some carbs and not waste the food but damn, i just love the baguette.

this place also carries my other favorite items such as werthers, oasis spinach hummus and baba ganoush, a good snapple (i know, it's trashy) assortment (diet lemon always in stock), the weekend NYT 

AND is right next to Okina sushi to boot.

If only they had soft serve chocolate ice cream....
author: Laurie A.

description:
i might be the only person in the world who is not crazy about arguello sammies. for starters, the bread is not good. its dry and flavorless. just like the turkey. there are so many better sandwiches in this city, and i've had most of them. 

the rest of the market is pretty good, they totally have pear looza which is like a sugary version of heaven to me. and they are a local market, so i give them kudos for survival.
author: shaine h.

description: Okay, so my BF loves turkey sandwiches, and I especially love 'em after Thanksgiving.  So, I really wanted to love this place since its close by my place.  We ordered the #1 lunch box special which had their famous roasted turkey sandwich on dutch crunch bread, broccoli pasta salad, two orange slices, and a square oreo-type cookie.  We also picked up the #2 lunch box - italian meats sandwich on dutch crunch, pesto pasta salad, etc....They came to $8.95 a piece.  The roasted turkey was allright.  I have to admit the dutch crunch bread was delicious and not at all the tough stuff that scrapes the roof of your mouth.  I'd say overall, it was "eh", but may go back to try it with ...dark meat and cranberry sauce
author: Jen C.

description: Great sandwiches and quality selection.  Can be a bit of a wait at lunchtime for a sandwich.  Prices are through the roof.  If you're on a budget shopping here will help you lose weight.  Its next door from my house but unless I'm in a hurry its always worth walking 7 blocks to Safeway to pay 40% less for the same items.
author: Charles K.

description: This place makes a fantabulous turkey sandwich.  Probably the best in town.  One caveat, make sure you don't go too late in the afternoon, because the choice cuts of fresh rotisserie turkey may be gone!
author: Chris D.

description: My wife and I *love* the turkey sandwich from the deli counter. It has become a Saturday tradition for us  to pick up one of these fresh-roasted, still-warm beauties. Yummy.
author: David G.

description: best grocery store in the naybahood. strange staff and good hot sauce to choose
author: aidan m.

description: Great little market. I usually just go there for milk and bread, but the folks are pleasant and there's some convenient sitting both inside and out if you get something from the Deli.
author: Matt J.

description: Love the sandwiches... I read the other reviews and its funny how some people write some reviews about how the sandwiches are over rated. FUCK its just a sandwich people. Do you expect it to tap dance in front of you for an hour before you eat it? Damn! Overpriced? Geez I would hate to go to some of the ghetto ass places some of these reviewers go. Its not that over priced, the sandwiches are good and Sal does take care of his employees you shit talking queens that have nothing better to do but bash other people... These reviews are about the business and customer service not to personally attack the owners that has nothing to do with your experience at this place.
author: T S.

description:
They have by far the greatest sandwiches in the city! No shredded lettuce, eww! Which is such an indicator for cheap and bad sandwiches-- shredded iceberg is watered down, has no nutritional value and they bleach for zeus' sake! They use Boars' Head deli meat, which is excellent quality and tasty, and they use fresh toppings. I always order the perfect sandwich: turkey on sourdough with mayo, swiss, avocado, lettuce, tomatoes, and you need their special trick SALT & PEPPER. I don't know what it is about the addition of salt and pepper but it makes it fabulous. You don't taste the grittyness of these additions but it gives it a subtle hint of flavor. 

Personal Experience: (Feel free to overlook this if you don't want to read my quick bitching)

One caution though.. I used to order in the market and sometimes wait in the long line around lunch and I always felt pressured to rush. I hated being that annoying customer with a custom sandwich but I such a sandwich snob I physically need it that way. So to avoid this I thought, I'll just phone in my order so I don't have to be annoying in person and I don't have to wait in line. BAD IDEA. I've done this the last two times and they completely messed up my orders! Even when they read it back to me! Then they acted like I ordered something else that I didn't! The first time it happened I was soooooo pissed I thought I was going to cry they made me a turkey sandwich with NO MAYO, only cranberries and lettuce.. UH?? what the hell? It was so upsetting that the next time I tried the phone order way, I checked my sandwiches once I left and they messed up again, not as bad as the the first. I went back to have them correct it and I think the boss/manager/owner has issues with the sandwich dudes and they secretly hate each other because they started fighting and I felt really bad. So a word of advice, just order there because even when speaking slowly on the phone they mess it up!
author: Diego S.

description: awesome hot, juicy, tender, and umm-umm-soo-good turkey sandwich!!  i'll come back just to sink my teeth into it again!
author: David A.

description:
Used to live a few blocks away from here and frequented all the time growing up. 

And MAN I do not lie, the turkey sandwiches are DA BOMB (only time I will ever use those words, and that's because stating they are yummy, doesn't even cover it). 

I haven't been there for a few years but based on the reviews they are still there, and still available in all their juicy juicy goodness. Oh and the dutch crunch rolls they had always were nice and fresh and they never skimped on the tomatoes or avocados when I ordered with them. Cheers!

A plus is that the owner is very nice like a previous review mentioned. Dad and him were friends and all that neighborhoodly jazz so he always asked about school and stuff. Nice dude.
author: Nana n.

description: a little pricey for my everyday shopping but arguello market has a great selection of quality items through out the store. they also have a better selection of vegetarian frozen foods than the big box grocery stores in the neighborhood. really nice staff as well. a wonderful asset to inner richmond.
author: Leuwam T.

description: You have to go here at least once while you live in the city to get the fresh roasted turkey sandwich.  The deli roast turkeys every single morning so they are perfect and nice and hot for lunch!  I recommend getting it on Dutch crunch bread with cranberry.  Sooo yummy, and affordable for a fresh sandwich.  Another plus- it's right next to an entrance to Golden Gate Park so you can grab a sandwich and go enjoy some nature!
author: Bridget G.

description: Great sandwich joint! My top favorite is the famous roasted turkey sandwich if your feeling crazy throw some avocado or cranberry sauce for some extra kick. My daily order is the bagel filled with lettuce, tomatoes, onions, avocado and don't forget the salt and pepper!
author: William N.

description: I've been addicted to Arguello Market since I was in undergrad at USF.  The sandwiches are fantastic.  I know everyone loves the famous turkey sandwich, but as a vegetarian, I love their veggie.  Lots of avocado and cheese and fresh veggies.  Call in ahead of time during the weekday lunch rush so you don't have to wait in line.  Sal, the owner, and the guys behind the deli counter are super nice and remember your name.  A great neighborhood place.  I got my two co-workers addicted to the turkey sandwiches and we used to come here 3x/week.  The sandwiches have gone up in price in recent years, but it's worth it.
author: Annie L.

description: Just a really, really great neighborhood grocery store with a great selection, great sandwiches, and friendly staff.
author: b w.

description: I live around the corner and come here regularly (like, at least once a week) for the sandwiches. Nothing better than walking down the block in my slippers hungover on a Sunday and standing in line for a sandwich.  Their roast turkey is good, but I tend to go for the peppercorn turkey instead.  A good sandwich, slightly overpriced but conveniently located groceries, decent beer and wine selection.  I'll keep coming here as long as I live in the neighborhood.
author: Julie H.

description: great deli to grab a quick sandwich then head into the park!  everyone raves about the turkey but i seem to get the salami most of the time.
author: jennifer l.

description: I moved into the neighborhood just over a year ago and I found this jewel by accident. I frequent this place at least once a week for a coffee, a breakfast sandwich, or an AMAZING turkey sandwich. Over this past holiday break I had 3 sandwiches in 4 days and each one got better and better. I highly recommend this place for anyone that lives in the area.
author: Deepak G.

description: friendly checkout staff, INSANELY DELICIOUS deli sandwiches. dont come here to shop for regular groceries though, cuz it aint cheap.  good for on-the-go type situations.
author: Jon H.

description: Love the turkey Sandos! I had to wait in line for a while but it was completely worth the wait!!!!  Everyone who works there are so sweet!
author: CC C.

description: If you happen and your in the inner Richmond, the Arguello Super Market has the greatest turkey sandwiches.  The meat is cut from a whole turkey that is on  a roaster.  You need to specify white or dark meat, or they will give you dark. It is really a treat.  They taste like the day after Thanksgiving.  I am going to give them 5 stars for the turkey sandwich only.  I can't judge the rest of the market.
author: Susan W.

description: while most items are overpriced their newman's virgin pink lemonade is dirt cheap.  works for me when i can't be bothered to walk the additional 8 blocks to safeway.
author: why l.
